title: AAAS: Science Advances: Table of Contents
description: Science Advances: Open access, multidisciplinary science journal.

items.title: Communication of perceptual predictions from the hippocampus to the deep layers of the parahippocampal cortex | Science Advances
items.description: High-resolution neuroimaging reveals stimulus-specific predictions sent from hippocampus to the neocortex during perception.

items.title: Individual clown anemonefish shrink to survive heat stress and social conflict | Science Advances
items.description: Clown anemonefish survive heatwaves by shrinking together with their breeding partner.

items.title: The end-Cretaceous mass extinction restructured functional diversity but failed to configure the modern marine biota | Science Advances
items.description: The end-Cretaceous mass extinction permanently disrupted the distribution of biodiversity among ecological functions.

items.title: Gradual labeling with fluorogenic probes: A general method for MINFLUX imaging and tracking | Science Advances
items.description: GLF-MINFLUX achieves 2.6-nm imaging and 200-μs live tracking in crowded cellular structures.

items.title: Seeing through arthropod eyes: An AI-assisted, biomimetic approach for high-resolution, multi-task imaging | Science Advances
items.description: AI-assisted biomimetic arthropod visual system enables full-color high-resolution panoramic imaging and visual cognition.

items.title: Macrophage hitchhiking nanomedicine for enhanced β-elemene delivery and tumor therapy | Science Advances
items.description: β-elemene–loaded GeS nanosheets use macrophage hitchhiking and ultrasound synergy for enhanced cancer therapy.

items.title: Control of ultrafast hot electron dynamics in epsilon-near-zero conductive oxide thin films | Science Advances
items.description: Laser power and mode excitation control hot electron relaxation, enabling ultrafast optical nonlinearity.

items.title: The impact of tropical cyclone exposure on infant mortality in low- and middle-income countries | Science Advances
items.description: Tropical cyclones increase infant mortality across seven low- and middle-income countries with uneven country-specific effects.

items.title: Increased maize chromosome number by engineered chromosome fission | Science Advances
items.description: A synthetic centromere was used to divide one maize chromosome into two chromosomes, and both functioned normally.

items.title: Controlled reversible methionine-selective sulfimidation of peptides | Science Advances
items.description: Site-specific methionine sulfimidation and glutathione concentration-dependent deconjugation in peptides were disclosed.
